alert.note: Alert for Clinch; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Ware, central Clinch and northwestern Charlton Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Boggy Bay to 7 miles east of Manor to Argyle to near Homerville. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, excessive cloud-to- ground lightning, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Homerville, Argyle, Stephen Foster State Park, Boggy Bay, Manor, Braganza, Race Pond and Needham. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Clinch; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
